This guitar solo caused plenty of contention between Freddie and fellow bandmate Brian May. Originally, May wanted nothing to do with the song, but Freddie Mercury managed to convince him to add at least a guitar solo in it. Upon closer listening, one will note this is the only part of the song that has any guitar parts at all.

I’m a shooting star leaping through the sky like a tiger
 Defying the laws of gravity

Fun fact!

Despite their bulky structure, tigers have been recorded to jump as high as 15-16 feet.

This astonishing feat is what Queen refers to as “defying the laws of gravity”.



He parallels the amount of fun he’s having tonight with this crazy, mind-boggling performance done by tigers.

Nothing will keep him down, not even gravity!

Like an atom bomb
 About to oh, oh, oh, oh, oh, explode
With the preceding reference to himself as a “sex machine”, Mercury is using the explosion of an atom bomb as a euphemism (or innuendo) for male ejaculation.

I’m a rocket ship on my way to Mars on a collision course
 I am a satellite, I’m out of control
 I’m a sex machine ready to reload

At the time, he was just going higher and higher. Queen on a whole were gaining tremendous momentum as a band and were becoming very popular. But as everyone knows, everything has to come to an end, or in this case a ‘collision course’ which would later see Freddie Mercury being diagnosed and eventually dying from HIV/AIDS.


According to his partner Jim Hutton, Mercury was diagnosed with AIDS shortly after Easter of 1987

On the evening of 24 November 1991, a little over 24 hours after issuing that statement, Mercury died at the age of 45 at his home in Kensington.


But in the meantime, he and Queen as a whole just kept going – getting greater, bigger and better. And more ironic is , following the diagnosis and death of Freddie Mercury – both Queen and Freddie became even more successful.

Brian May also named an asteroid after Freddie on September 5th, 2016, to celebrate his 70th birthday.

(Don’t stop me now)
 I’m having such a good time
 I’m having a ball
 (Don’t stop me now)
 If you wanna have a good time
 Just give me a call
 (Don’t stop me now)
 ’Cause I’m having a good time
 (Don’t stop me now)
 Yes, I’m having a good time
 I don’t wanna stop at all, yeah

He’s having an exhilarating time.

At the time Freddie Mercury the lead singer of Queen was in his prime. They were releasing several hit songs, his only request then was that it would never, ever stop.

I’m burning through the sky, yeah
 Two hundred degrees, that’s why they call me Mister Fahrenheit

Freddie Mercury moves so fast and hot that he’s like a shooting star moving through space and time. 200 hundred degrees is pretty damn hot (about 93.3 degrees Celsius), though shooting stars generally reach temperatures of thousands of degrees before they explode or vaporize in the Earth’s atmosphere. Fahrenheit can also be taken as a pun, due to its pronunciation of “heit” as “height”, referring to the measurement of two hundred degrees.



It should also be noted that Freddie’s full name, Freddie Mercury, has an element which was used in thermometers for about three centuries. Also, Mercury was the messenger of the gods, renowned for his speed. The speed of matter is also roughly analogous to its temperature.

I’m travelling at the speed of light
 I wanna make a supersonic man outta you

Freddie is a player and he cannot be held down, He is “traveling at the speed of light”, and whether you are a Man (1st time sings Man) or a Woman (2nd time sings Woman) if you are with him, you will end up traveling at a fraction of his speed (supersonic). This is a reference to the fact that he was bisexual.
I’m a racing car passing by like Lady Godiva

Lady Godiva is an (apocryphal) English noblewoman known for riding a horse through the streets of Coventry stark naked. The phrase “peeping Tom” also comes from her legend.



The speaker’s audacity and unsurpassed sexuality will cause everyone to stop and stare.
